page.title: 04WILD LIFE
page.content: A large number of wild{Roe Deer}roam the woods around Loxwood and Plaistow, and are often encountered crossing the roads.{Wild rabbits}cause farmers a great deal of anxiety in the area, as do{mink.}After the Second World War a number of people went in for mink breeding and there was once a mink farm at Bucks Green. When the mink escaped they began breeding in the river banks, producing large litters and causing concern to the River Authorities. {Kingfishers}are often seen by the river and in the woods, as are{Yellow {Wagtails, Nightingales, Barn Owls amd {Herons. {Sea trout}are frequently caught in the river, and{brown trout}also.
